name: Andrea Guzman
seo_page_description_principals_only: Andrea is an Arizona desert native who leads RSM Design’s Health and Life Science Practice, focused on creating transformative and holistically human centered experiences.
headshot_description: Headshot image of Andrea Guzman an associate principal at RSM Design
featured_image_description: Detail image of wayfinding in a healthcare facility.
bio:
Andrea is an Arizona desert native who enjoys being outdoors in nature and concocting homemade jams, chile con carne and tortillas. She has a degree in Humanities and a strong intellectual interest in human behavior and experience in the built environment. Andrea leads RSM Design’s Health & Wellness and Life Science Practice, focused on creating transformative and holistically human centered experiences. Additionally, she leads higher education, civic, workplace and mixed-use projects. As a leader, Andrea takes great care to foster a collaborative and participatory design process. Her vast portfolio demonstrates a strong expertise in wayfinding master planning and strategy-research based work. She is passionate about bringing systems based thinking to planning and design solutions that emphasize a comprehensive and multi-disciplinary approach. Through the creation of a defined methodology, she leads user testing and prototyping efforts to deliver evidence based data that supports a clients’ ROI.

Andrea is known for her empathy, authenticity, patience, listening skills and ability to facilitate consensus across large and diverse groups of stakeholders. Andrea has over 20 years of experience working with clients such as Kaiser Permanente, Dignity Health, and UCLA Health in addition to many community based health systems and clinics.

Her contributions to significant projects include:

The decade long Kaiser Oakland Flagship Replacement Hospital, Thomas Jefferson University Hospitals, UCLA Santa Monica and Westwood Campuses, Alaska Native Tribal Health Consortium, Common Spirit Baylor St. Luke’s Medical Center, Texas Woman’s University, University of Houston Clearlake Campus, South San Francisco Community Civic Campus, County of Santa Clara, Workday Multi-Modal Transit Campus and City of Mountainview North Bayshore.
education:
New College of California, B.A. Humanities

University of Berkeley Extension - Project Management
expertise:
Wayfinding Master Planning

Interactive Experiences & Placemaking

Evidence Based Design - Strategy & Research 

User Testing & Prototyping

Program & Change Management

name: Christy Montgomery
seo_page_description_principals_only: As associate principal at RSM Design, Christy Montgomery brings seasoned experience to the table with a focus on maintaining a consistent vision from concept through final installation. Since 2002, her strength is in defining and addressing the unique challenges of every project.
bio:
Christy Montgomery is currently working as an associate principal at RSM Design. She uses analysis of the site context combined with creative thinking to build intuitive wayfinding, compelling narratives, and deeply meaningful connections. She is passionate about maintaining a consistent vision from concept through final installation.

Christy approaches each project with care, consideration, and attention to detail. She starts every project by defining the unique challenges of the site and its users. This process starts with listening, research, and careful analysis. Once this foundation is in place, the next step is getting fired up with inspiration. Every step thereafter fuses what's possible with what's needed to truly move people. Christy's mission is to improve and transform places to the benefit of the communities they serve.
education:
Willamette University, BA Art and Politics

Art Center College of Design, BFA Graphic Design
expertise:
Wayfinding

Mixed-Use

Park Design

Education Design

Donor Recognition

Residential & Multifamily

Project Management

name: Cody Clark
seo_page_description_principals_only: As Director of RSM Design's studio in Los Angeles Cody leads many of our project's branding initiatives. Weaving his years of experience as a typographic and branding expert with the physical manifestations of the brand in the built environment to create exciting narratives that engage and inspire.
full_title: Principal, Director of Los Angeles Office
bio:
Cody Clark is the Director of RSM Design's studio in Los Angeles, and leads many of our project's branding initiatives. He weaves his years of experience as a typographic and branding expert with the physical manifestations of the brand in the built environment to create exciting narratives that engage and inspire.
‍

He has built an award-winning career by creating contemporary storytelling within architectural and public space environments. Cody believes in building projects around a client informed process which is led by asking great questions, resulting in meaningful and economically successful projects. He specializes in transmedia solutions using platforms in wayfinding, environmental graphics and media-driven surfaces for mixed-use retail, residential, office, city/civic, and hospitality projects. He has a strong voice within the industry by developing a range of speaking engagements around topics ranging from technology led experiences to the future of wayfinding and mobility.


His contributions on first-in-class, globally significant projects from Dallas to Delhi including: BAR Center at the Beach, the iconic waterfront community hub designed by Belzberg Architects for the Jewish Federation of Los Angeles. Aerocity, a vibrant aerotropolis connected to Indira Gandhi International Airport, located in New Delhi, India. The award winning Miami Baywalk, this globally recognized branded waterfront celebrating the future of Miami.

In addition to his contributions within the profession, he has focused on the development of Spatial and Branded Graphics curriculum, as an instructor in the Environmental Design Department at Art Center College of Design. He currently instructs classes within the Undergraduate and Graduate Programs ranging from Exhibition Design, Portfolio Studio to specialty sponsored or topic studio classes.
education: Art Center College of Design, BA Graphic Design

Blending Technology and Traditional Processes

name: Harry Mark, FAIA
seo_page_description_principals_only: While art directing project teams within the three RSM Design studios, Harry Mark, FAIA brings his international architectural background and graphic design sensibilities to each collaborative project.
bio:
While art directing project teams within the three RSM Design studios, Harry Mark, FAIA brings his international architectural background and graphic design sensibilities to each collaborative project. As the Executive Director of the firm, Harry works at this intersection of architecture and graphics and leads the projects and teams to understand the importance of and the symbiotic relationship between graphics and signage within the built environment. His work has helped transform difficult user experiences in buildings, adding a layer of clarity and organization with unexpected graphic interventions.

Early in Harry’s career he honed his design and graphic sensibilities while working internationally as an Associate with RTKL and as a Senior Associate with HOK Architects. Additionally, before focusing his career in the environmental graphics realm, Harry established an independent architecture and graphics studio in Dallas, Texas, focusing on unique design interventions at a smaller scale. As a respected author and frequent speaker on industry issues and the recipient of numerous design awards, Harry’s designs and written articles have been published in several national magazines and journals and featured in exhibits throughout the United States. In 2015 Harry was elected to The College of Fellows of The American Institute of Architects. The Jury of Fellows cited Harry’s “notable contributions to the advancement of the profession of architecture.”

Harry earned his Bachelor of Architecture from The University of Texas at Austin and a Master of Architecture from the University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Fine Arts. Harry has been a registered architect for over 25 years, and an active member of the American Institute of Architects (AIA). Harry is the editor of the architecture and community publication of the city of Dallas, Columns Magazine, and the co-founder, current publisher, and editor-in-chief for the design publication, Architype Review. Additionally, for the past 24 years Harry has been the senior architect at the Aphrodisias Archaeological Excavations in Turkey for Oxford University and New York University, spending each summer directing and teaching a team of graduate students in documenting and reconstructing classical antiquities.

University of Texas, Bachelor of Architecture

name: Jeffrey Hertzler
seo_page_description_principals_only: Jeff is a Southern California native who has a passion for all facets of design and composition. As a Design Director, he works through all stages of the creative process with a keen interest in quality materials, creative fabrication techniques, and specialty elements.
featured_image_description: Office employees discuss and brainstorm a project.
bio: Jeff is a Southern California native who has a passion for all facets of design and composition. As an associate principal and design director, he works through all stages of the creative process with a keen interest in quality materials, creative fabrication techniques, and specialty elements that engage users in new and relevant ways. He brings his expertise in psychology, wayfinding strategies, and brand development along with years of experience in graphic design to create user-focused solutions, innovative spaces, and stimulating experiences that inspire creativity, engagement, and connection. Jeff joined the RSM Design team in 2011 and has had the opportunity to work on over 150 projects across the U.S. and in 15 countries around the world.

name: Kyle Richter
seo_page_description_principals_only: Kyle passionately serves as a Principal and the Director of the San Clemente Office. His leadership and design vision provide direction for many of the studio’s large scale projects, providing efficient and effective guidance for the team to bring unexpected and creative solutions.
full_title: Principal, Director of San Clemente Office
bio:
Kyle passionately serves as a Principal and the Director of the San Clemente Office. His leadership and design vision provide direction for many of the studio’s large scale projects, providing efficient and effective guidance for the team to bring unexpected and creative solutions. His commitment to the vision is expressed through the details that enrich the project experience, such as unique solutions for paving design, added graphic texture in the project landscape or a thoughtfully designed landmark. These details are the elements that broaden the brand with richness and depth.

His focus on process also helps to align project vision with client goals through a dynamic and detail-oriented management style. He has a deep investment into every step of the process, from visioning to concepting, design development to detailing and construction to post-project follow-up.

name: Martin E Schwartz
seo_page_description_principals_only: Founding and managing partner Martin Schwartz steers the future direction of RSM Design as the team’s CVO – Chief Visionary Officer. Martin is deeply committed to challenging the studio’s practice to stay at the forefront of environmental graphic design.
bio:
Founding and managing partner Martin Schwartz steers the future direction of RSM Design as the team’s CVO – Chief Visionary Officer. Martin is deeply committed to challenging the studio’s practice to stay at the forefront of environmental graphic design as an industry thought leader in philosophy, process and delivery. An architect by training, his background insightfully guides the way he brings together the aspirations of the design and development teams into a synergistic process that results in innovative and inspired projects.

Martin’s core objective is to passionately advocate for Creative Leadership in developing the design process through active collaboration, a compelling vision and a disciplined process. He believes in a “Principle-Centered Design” approach that seeks to detect each project’s unique character rather than invention. This has helped to foster a strong sense of design integrity to unify the vision, values and purpose in his work.

Martin holds a Bachelor of Architecture and Business degree from the University of Texas, in addition to specialized coursework at Virginia Polytechnic Institute in Switzerland. Martin is actively involved with the American Institute of Architects (AIA), the Society of Experiential Graphic Designers (SEGD), Urban Land Institute (ULI), and the International Council of Shopping Centers (ICSC).

Virginia Polytechnic Institute in Switzerland, Specialized Coursework

name: Scott Schwieterman
seo_page_description_principals_only: Originally from Kansas City, has been crafting unique experiential design environments for over 20 years. Throughout his career, Scott has worked on more than 20 sports projects, 15 retail projects, 10 workplace projects, multiple healthcare facilities and a variety of brand experience projects.
headshot_description: Black and white headshot image of Scott Schwieterman
featured_image_description: A person holding up a piece of material used in signage design.
bio:
Scott Schwieterman, originally from Kansas City, has been crafting unique experiential design environments for over 20 years.  Scott graduated from Wichita State University with a Bachelor’s in Graphic Design and additional Minors in Business and Fine Arts. His primary portfolio consists of designing large scale wayfinding systems and sponsorship packages for sports architecture projects such as Lambeau Field and Kauffman Stadium. During his practice, Scott has also worked to integrate a revised brand across multiple touchpoints and facilities at educational campuses such as the University of Pittsburgh and the University of Virginia. His diverse project experience allows him to bring a holistic approach to every project, looking at each challenge from 10,000 feet above and down to the smallest details.

Scott also brings many years of experience leading teams and developing talent all while building trust with his clients. He has collaborated with designers from diverse backgrounds and skill sets to uncover a project’s authentic vision. To Scott, there is no project too large or small. Instead it’s about producing the highest level of design that is both unique and thoughtful, as well as conveys meaning through storytelling and unconventional design thinking.  

Throughout his career, Scott has worked on more than 20 sports projects, 15 retail projects, 10 workplace projects, multiple healthcare facilities and a variety of brand experience projects across the globe.
education: Wichita State University, BA Graphic Design, Minor Business and Fine Arts
expertise:
Brand Development

Spacial Design

Placemaking and Brand Integration

Wayfinding Design and Sponsorship Implementation

Concept Design Direction

‍

name: Stephanie Wills
seo_page_description_principals_only: As a principal, Stephanie is involved in all facets of the project from proposal and scope preparation through direction of staff to efficiently meeting the needs of clients. Stephanie’s leadership and client interface are pivotal in stewarding strong client relationships.
bio:
As a principal, Stephanie is involved in all facets of the project from proposal and scope preparation through direction of staff to efficiently meeting the needs of clients. Stephanie’s leadership and client interface are pivotal in stewarding strong client relationships, ensuring that the integrity of each project’s vision is achieved.

Stephanie’s dual degrees in public relations and fine art are an ideal pair for RSM Design’s philosophy, enabling her to engage clients while also directing project teams within the firm. Utilizing her strong background in sign fabrication, construction and details, Stephanie spearheads tenant signage criteria and design guideline development for many of the projects of the studio, navigating through the minutiae of requirements that serve as directives for a wide variety of retail and mixed-use projects.
education: California State University, Fullerton, BA, Communication and Art
banner_grid_image_description: Headshot of RSM design team member Stephanie Wills in black and white.

name: Steve Luoma
seo_page_description_principals_only: Steve Luoma is an Associate Designer at RSM Design who focuses on logo design and brand development. His process utilizes user focused analysis to create impactful brands that target the right consumers.
headshot_description: Steve Luoma Associate at RSM Design headshot in black and white
featured_image_description: Outdoor plants and chair at a deck in front of the San Clemente RSM Design office
bio: Steve Luoma received his MS in Communications Design from Pratt Institute, as well as a BA in Art History from Vanderbilt University. Since then, Steve has focused his career to service a wide variety of clients’ needs, from initial strategy through design implementation. His work has spanned a diverse set of disciplines, including branding, packaging, digital design and the built environment. His process utilizes user focused analysis to develop engaging and impactful brand narratives, creating greater meaning and connection between clients and their audience.

name: Suzanne Redmond Schwartz
seo_page_description_principals_only: Founding partner Suzanne Redmond Schwartz directs, manages and inspires the RSM Design team with her infectious enthusiasm for connecting people to place. Suzanne distills the essence of a brand and realizes it in the built environment with clarity, purpose and imagination.
bio:
Founding partner Suzanne Redmond Schwartz directs, manages and inspires the RSM Design team with her infectious enthusiasm for connecting people to place. Suzanne distills the essence of a brand and realizes it in the built environment with clarity, purpose and imagination. Always keeping every element on brand, the larger story is seamlessly integrated into the appropriate architectural look and feel that is customized for every project. She brings valuable insights to make tangible the transformative power of design.

Her world class experience has transformed projects from Saudi Arabia to Southern California, earning accolades and positioning RSM Design as a global leader in architectural graphic design. Suzanne has the keen ability to see and find the extraordinary in the ordinary by applying the principle that no design problem is too small or large to yield something magnificent, wherever the project may be.

Suzanne holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Graphic Design and Packaging from Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, as well as a Bachelor of Science degree in Business from UC Santa Barbara. Suzanne is also actively involved with the Society of Experiential Graphic Designers (SEGD) and Women Business Enterprise (WBE).
education:
Art Center College of Design, BFA Graphic Design & Packaging

UC Santa Barbara, BS Business

bio: Will is intrigued by the precise details of structure and design. With a graphic designer and mechanical engineer as parents, Will was tailor made for Industrial Design, honing his talent and skills at Arizona State University, graduating in 2013. He works through all aspects of the design process seeking to find the optimal intersection between form and function. Will taps his industrial design background in seeking user-focused solutions, modeling and rendering to visualize the experience.
